definition: medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
leaf of the iris/variant of 藥|药[yao4]

pinyin: chuan2 tong3 zhong1 guo2 yi1 yao4
Bei3 jing1 Zhong1 yi1 yao4 Da4 xue2
Guang3 zhou1 Zhong1 yi1 yao4 Da4 xue2

definition: separating medical consultation from dispensing drugs, proposed policy to counteract perceived PRC problem of "drugs serving to nourish doctors" 以藥養醫|以药养医[yi3 yao4 yang3 yi1]

sentences.english: It was originally used medicinally by the Egyptians.
sentences.chinese: 它最初被埃及人用于医药方面。

sentences.english: At the same time, Li Shizhen Medicine Innovation Award is presented at first.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，李时珍医药创新奖也在会上首次颁发。

sentences.english: Traditional Chinese Medicine Committee of Diabetes.
sentences.chinese: 中国中医药学会消渴病专业委员会。

sentences.english: Mingxia Dong now houses a government project researching Chinese medicine.
sentences.chinese: 明霞洞现在是政府的一个中医药项目研究基地。

sentences.english: Traditional Chinese medicine has a history of thousands of years.
sentences.chinese: 中国医药学有着数千年的历史。

sentences.english: However, the survivals of EMPs are influence by critical mass, Industrial characteristic, and standard data exchange format.
sentences.chinese: 医药产业通路特性关系及是否具备资料转换标准影响。

sentences.english: He has also held seminars at Samra University of Oriental, Medicine.
sentences.chinese: 他后来也在东方萨姆拉中医药大学举行研讨会。

sentences.english: As quickly as she could, Miss Zhao got a medicine box.
sentences.chinese: 赵老师以最快地速度拿起了医药箱。

sentences.english: Production of some Pharma Machineries and equipment.
sentences.chinese: 医药机械及设备的生产。

sentences.english: Urgently allocating and transporting central medical reserve to support quake-hit areas.
sentences.chinese: 一是紧急调运中央医药储备支援灾区。

sentences.english: A medicine chest above the bathroom sink.
The bill was sent to her room.
sentences.chinese: 当医药费通知单送到她的病房时，她不敢看。

sentences.english: I want to buy shares in a multi-national pharmaceutical company.
sentences.chinese: 我想购买一家跨国医药公司的股票。

sentences.english: Breeding drugs would be a medical boon .
sentences.chinese: 药物繁育是医药学的一个恩惠。

sentences.english: The doctor decided to chance his arms and try to write a book on medicine.
sentences.chinese: 这个医生决定碰碰运气，试着写一本关于医药的书。

definition: chemical industry, abbr. of 化學工業|化学工业[hua4 xue2 gong1 ye4]/chemical engineering, abbr. of 化學工程|化学工程[hua4 xue2 gong1 cheng2]
household electric appliance/abbr. for 家用電器|家用电器
non-ferrous metals (all metals excluding iron, chromium, manganese and their alloys)
